paragraph.heading:
Dendrobium aphyllum (Roxb.) C.E.C.Fisch.
in J.S.Gamble, Fl. Madras : 1416, 1928

subSubSection.paragraph:
Basionym:
Limodorum aphyllum Roxb., Pl. Coromandel
1: 34, 1795. Homotypic synonym:
Callista aphylla (Roxb.) Kuntze, Revis.
Gen . Pl.
2: 653, 1891. Heterotypic synonyms:
Dendrobium cucullatum R.Br., Bot. Reg.
7: t. 548, 1821.
Dendrobium pierardii Roxb. ex Hook. var. cucullatum

(R.Br.) Hook.f.,
Fl. Brit. India
5: 739, 1890, nom. illeg.
Dendrobium aphyllum (Roxb.) C.E.C.Fisch. var. cucullatum (R.Br.)

P.K.Sarkar, J. Econ. Taxon. Bot. 5: 1007, 1984.
Dendrobium pierardii Roxb. ex Hook., Exot. Fl.

Distribution:— India , the Himalayas, Myanmar , Thailand , Indochina, southwestern and southern China and Peninsular Malaysia .

Note:— Dickason 9188 has a basally trilobed lip but is identical in every other critical feature with typical
D. aphyllum .
